events.summary: Kaprálová was born in Brno to a musical family, which only makes sense since she was destined to compose like a boss. Being the daughter of a composer and a singer, musical traits practically dripped from her cradle.

From the age of 15, she embarked on a quest for knowledge in music, studying composition and conducting. Little did she know these years would be vital, setting the stage for her future as a musical sorceress.

In a moment that screamed 'Look at me, I'm fabulous!', she conducted the Czech Philharmonic, showcasing her composition 'Military Sinfonietta'. You can almost hear the orchestra saying, 'Finally, a conductor with class!'
The very next year she took her talents to the BBC Orchestra, further solidifying her status as the most sought-after musician in her social circle – the 'cool kid' of classical music, if you will.

As a cherry on top, she tied the knot with Czech writer Jiří Mucha just two months before her untimely departure from this world. Talk about a whirlwind romance, though it was unfortunately short-lived!

Kaprálová passed away at the tender age of 25, possibly from typhoid fever. It's a classic plot twist in her story that her promising career ended before it could peak, leaving audiences wanting more.
